title: Non linear $\sigma$ models : renormalisability versus geometry
abstract: After some recalls on the standard (non)-linear $\sigma$ model, we discuss the interest of B.R.S. symmetry in non-linear $\sigma$ models renormalisation. We also emphasise the importance of a correct definition of a theory through physical constraints rather than as given by a particular Lagrangian and discuss some ways to enlarge the notion of renormalisability.
